paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses various aspects of transthyretin (TTR) amyloidosis, including specific variants associated with the disease, but does not provide detailed penetrance data or individual case information.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met variant is known to be associated with familial amyloid polyneuropathy.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.source_location: Main Text, paragraph discussing TTR variants
variants.additional_notes: This variant is one of the most studied in relation to TTR amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The most spread mutations are Val30Met which is associated to FAP.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile variant is associated with familial amyloid cardiomyopathy.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.source_location: Main Text, paragraph discussing TTR variants
variants.additional_notes: This variant is prevalent in certain populations, particularly among individuals of African descent.

functional_data.summary: The Asp18Gly variant is implicated in some central nervous system damaging.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.source_location: Main Text, paragraph discussing TTR variants
variants.additional_notes: Less common than Val30Met and Val122Ile.
key_quotes: Asp18Gly and Ala23Thr which are involved in some central nervous system damaging.

functional_data.summary: The Ala23Thr variant is also associated with central nervous system damage.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.source_location: Main Text, paragraph discussing TTR variants
key_quotes: Ala23Thr which are involved in some central nervous system damaging.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant TTR variants were extracted, but detailed penetrance data was not provided.
